{{also|Drei|Dréi}} ==Central Franconian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gmw-cfr|goh|drī}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gmw-cfr|/dʀei̯/}} ===Numeral=== {{head|gmw-cfr|numeral}} # {{lb|gmw-cfr|most dialects}} [[three]] ---- ==German== {{cardinalbox|de|2|3|4|zwei|vier|ord=dritte}} ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|drey}} {{qualifier|obsolete}} * {{l|de|Drei}} {{qualifier|when used substantively}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|drī}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*þrīz}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*tréyes}}. Compare {{cog|nl|drie}}, {{cog|en|three}}, {{cog|da|tre}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/dʁaɪ̯/|[dʁaɪ̯]}} * {{audio|de|De-drei.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aɪ̯}} ===Numeral=== {{head|de|numeral|cat2=cardinal numbers}} # [[three]] {{gloss|numerical value represented by the Arabic numeral 3; or ''describing a set with three elements''}} #* '''1845''', Carl von Holtei, ''Theater. In einem Bande'', Breslau, page 370: #*: Wenn also diese Küsse zu dem letzten
Gerechnet werden, ist die Summe '''drei''',
Wie aller guten Dinge '''dreie''' sind. ====Declension==== * Nominative and accusative are nowadays always uninflected. The substantival form {{m|de|dreie}} is nowadays dialectal. * The genitive case takes the form '''{{m|de|dreier}}''' if no article or pronoun is preceding: ''Vater '''dreier''' Kinder'' – “a father '''of three''' children”. But: ''der Vater der '''drei''' Kinder'' – “the father of the '''three''' children”. The form ''dreier'' is somewhat elevated; even in formal writing it is sometimes more natural to avoid it (''Vater von '''drei''' Kindern''). * The dative case is often uninflected in adjectival use: ''Ich sprach mit '''drei''' Zeugen.'' – “I spoke with '''three''' witnesses.” When used as a noun, it may take the form '''{{m|de|dreien}}''': ''Ich sprach mit '''dreien'''.'' – ''literally'', “I spoke with '''three'''.” This rule is usually observed in formal standard German; but when a specification in the genitive case (or with {{m|de|von|}}) is following, the bare form is common: ''Ich sprach mit '''drei''' der Zeugen.'' – “I spoke with '''three''' of the witnesses.” In colloquial German, ''dreien'' is never obligatory. ====Coordinate terms==== {{de-cardinal}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |Drei |dreiarmig |dreibeinig |dreiblättrig |[[Dreieck]] ([[dreieckig]]) |Dreieinigkeit |Dreier |Dreierbündnis |dreierlei |Dreiertakt |[[dreifach]] ([[Dreifachturnhalle]]) |[[dreifaltig]] ([[Dreifaltigkeit]]) |dreifarben |dreifarbig |dreifüßig |Dreiheit |dreijährig |Dreikampf |Dreikäsehoch |Dreilaut |[[Dreimaster]] ([[dreimastig]]) |dreimotorig |dreiprozentig |Dreirad |Dreisatz |dreiseitig |dreisilbig |Dreisprung |dreißig |dreistellig |Dreisternehotel |dreistufig |dreitägig |dreiteilig |[[dreiwöchig]], [[dreiwöchentlich]] |[[Dreizack]] ([[dreizackig]]) |dreizehn |halbdrei |[[verdreifachen]] ([[Verdreifachung]]) }} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} * {{R:DWDS}} [[Category:de:Three]] ---- ==German Low German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|nds-de|dree||some dialects}} ===Etymology=== Compare {{inh|nds-de|osx|thrīe}}, from {{inh|nds-de|gem-pro|*þrīz}}, from {{inh|nds-de|ine-pro|*tréyes}}. Ultimately cognate to {{cog|de|drei}}, {{cog|nl|drie}}, {{cog|en|three}}, {{cog|pdt|dree}}. ===Numeral=== {{head|nds-de|numeral|cat2=cardinal numbers}} # {{lb|nds-de|Low Prussian|Münsterländisch}} [[three]] (3) ====See also==== * {{q|Münsterländisch}} {{l|nds-de|twee||two}}; {{l|nds-de|veer||four}}; {{l|nds-de|fyv}}; {{l|nds-de|seß}}; ; ; {{l|nds-de|niegen}}; {{l|nds-de|tein||ten}}; {{l|nds-de|twintig||twenty}}; {{l|nds-de|hundert}}; {{l|nds-de|duusend}} — {{l|nds-de|eerste||first}}; {{l|nds-de|tweede}}; {{l|nds-de|diädde}}; {{l|nds-de|veerde}} ---- ==Hunsrik== {{cardinalbox|hrx|2|3|4|zweu|fier|ord=dritt}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|hrx|goh|drī}}, from {{inh|hrx|gem-pro|*þrīz}}, from {{inh|hrx|ine-pro|*tréyes}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/traɪ̯/}} ===Numeral=== {{head|hrx|numeral}} # {{cln|hrx|cardinal numbers}} [[three]] #: {{ux|hrx|Meer hon '''drei''' Kinner.|We have '''three''' children.}} ===Further reading=== *[https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Middle English== ===Adjective=== {{head|enm|adjective}} # {{alt form|enm|drye}} ---- ==Norwegian Bokmål== ===Verb=== {{head|nb|verb form}} # {{inflection of|nb|dreie||imp}} ---- ==Pennsylvania German== {{cardinalbox|pdc|2|3|4|zwee|vier|ord=dritt}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|pdc|goh|drī}}, from {{inh|pdc|gem-pro|*þrīz}}, from {{inh|pdc|ine-pro|*tréyes}}.
